greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of totient functions over arguments running through numbers unrelated to n.
comment: Phi-summation over numbers not exceeding n are given in A002088, over divisor-set of n would give n, over RRS or unrelated numbers to n give newer values: at n=36 these values are {396,36,191,170}. This is a further way of Phi-summation.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: n=36 and its "unrelated-set" is {8,10,14,15,16,20,21,22,24,26,27,28,30,32,33,34} and their totients are {4,4,6,8,8,8,12,10,8,12,18,12,8,16,20,16}. The sum of these values is 170, so a(36)=170. For primes the unrelated set is empty and Phi-sum over empty set is 0.
maple: for m from 2 to n-1 do
if igcd(m,n) >1 and not m in dvs then
mathematica: Table[Total@ EulerPhi@ Select[Range@ n, 1 < GCD[#, n] < # &], {n, 68}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 05 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 17 2000
